intro: Jaumeopsis, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are characterized by their upright, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, greenish or reddish flowers. Jaumeopsis species typically thrive in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough, textured surface. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
